caption.body: Colombian-Belgian Annabelle Lopez Ochoa (b. 1973) trained at the Royal Ballet School of Antwerp, Belgium. She danced for twelve years before becoming a choreographer in 2003. Her varied repertoire includes short conceptual pieces, full-length narratives, and dance films. Lopez Ochoa has created works for over seventy dance companies worldwide, including ğ˜ğ˜³ğ˜ªğ˜¥ğ˜¢ for the Dutch National Ballet (2020), which explores the life of Mexican painter Frida Kahlo. She is currently working on her first evening-length work for Ballet HispaÌnico in New York, ğ˜‹ğ˜°ğ˜¯Ìƒğ˜¢ ğ˜—ğ˜¦ğ˜³ğ˜°Ìğ˜¯, which portrays the life of Argentinean former First Lady Eva PeroÌn. In 2019, she received the prestigious Jacobâ€™s Pillow Dance Award; she currently lives in Amsterdam.  In the choreography for her ballet, ğ˜ğ˜¶ğ˜¦ğ˜³ğ˜¯ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢, Lopez Ochoa sought to answer the question â€œHow do you put cubism into movement?â€ She created cubist effects by arranging dancers into poses, so that the brain appears to see four heads and only two legs.  Special thank you to San Francisco Ballet for making this exhibition possible.
